result.execSummary:
The defendant Alena M Mendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 2 days if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 7 months, if all conditions are met and agent deems appropriate. 
No Violent contact with the victim. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores). 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alena M Mendez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Postconviction Relief;  filed by Atty. Priya Barnes
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

8:32AM - Case not called on the Record.
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Alena M Mendez.  
Defendant Alena M Mendez in court.  
Attorney Barnes requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 10:16 AM 
Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Alena M Mendez in court with attorney Priya Barnes. 
Defense requests that the bail conditions be modified to remove CAM Monitoring.
State objects.
Court will Grant the motion, CAM monitoring will be lifted.
Attorney Barnes requests another hearing date.  Court grants.



  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Alena M Mendez in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Attorney Barnes objects to the witness called by the State and presents arguments.
ADA Tempelis presents counter arguments and states the witness has knowledge of the case.
The Court overrules the objection and allows the State witness to testify.

Detective Kenny Stucker, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Barnes.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion for Modification of Bond
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 06/09/2022:  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, or Victim A and Witness A's residences.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

01:02 PM Defendant Alena M Mendez in court with attorney Priya Barnes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A and Witness A appeared in court with Victim/Witness specialist.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Attorney Barnes presents arguments and requests a no violent contact.
The Court notes that Witness A filed a letter with the court.
The Court will only allow Victim A to present a statement to the court.
Victim A presents a statement to the Court.
The State does not object.
The Court grants the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.  The Court modifies conditions.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Motions and Order to seal victim's request to be heard - signed and sealed
Bail/bond hearing on June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to modify and change condition on signature bond. Sent to CC Rieck to review. Court's response: May be modified at next court date unless Defense Atty. wants it sooner.
To be signed by the court - Motion and order to Seal Victim's request to be heard
victim request to be heard filed by Victim Witness/DA's office
appointing Attorney Priya Barnes
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, or Victim A and Witness A's residences.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

01:58 PM Defendant Alena M Mendez in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court orders no contact with Victim A and Witness A and a potential modification would only be considered if Victim A or Witness A comes into Court and states why the terms and conditions should be modified or contacts Victim witness to address a modification.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
